intro: Gnetum acutatum, commonly known as the tropical balsa or balsa tree, is a member of the Gnetophyta division, which includes gymnosperms. It is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and compound leaves that are alternate and pinnately arranged. Its most notable feature is the production of lightweight, porous wood that is highly buoyant and used in model building and other crafts. Gnetum acutatum plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
